items.q: What areas do you serve?
items.a: We cover all of New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

items.q: Are you licensed and insured?
items.a: Yes. We are fully licensed and insured in NJ & PA and comply with all local building codes.

items.q: Do you handle permits and inspections?
items.a: Yes. We submit required permits, coordinate inspections, and keep you informed at every step.

items.q: How do you minimize disruption during the project?
items.a: We protect adjacent areas, keep tidy job sites, and schedule work efficiently with regular updates.

items.q: Do you provide warranties?
items.a: Yes. We offer manufacturer product warranties and workmanship warranties on labor.

items.q: Can you help with kitchen layout and design?
items.a: Absolutely. We plan efficient layouts, cabinetry, storage, lighting, and materials to match your style and budget.

items.q: Do you install custom cabinets and countertops?
items.a: Yes. We offer custom and semi-custom cabinetry, plus durable countertop options like quartz and granite.

items.q: How long does a typical kitchen remodel take?
items.a: Most kitchens take 4–8 weeks depending on scope, materials, and any structural changes.

items.q: Do you replace flooring and lighting as part of the project?
items.a: Yes. We can include flooring, recessed lighting, under-cabinet lights, and fixture upgrades in your scope.

items.q: Do you remodel small bathrooms and powder rooms?
items.a: Yes. We optimize compact spaces with smart layouts, storage, and fixture choices.

items.q: Can you build walk-in showers or accessible baths?
items.a: Yes. We offer curbless showers, grab bars, bench seating, and wider doorways to improve accessibility.

items.q: How long does a bathroom remodel take?
items.a: Typical full bath projects take 3–6 weeks. Simple refreshes can be faster.

items.q: Do you handle waterproofing and ventilation?
items.a: Yes. We use proper waterproofing methods and ensure code-compliant ventilation to prevent moisture issues.

items.q: What roofing materials do you install?
items.a: We install architectural asphalt shingles, metal roofing, and more—selected for durability and local climate.

items.q: How long does a roof replacement take?
items.a: Most residential roofs are completed in 1–2 days, weather permitting.

items.q: Do you remove the old roof and handle disposal?
items.a: Yes. We remove old materials, inspect decking, and haul away debris responsibly.

items.q: Can you assess ventilation and attic insulation?
items.a: Yes. We review intake/exhaust ventilation and can advise on insulation improvements.

items.q: Do you install energy-efficient windows and doors?
items.a: Yes. We install ENERGY STAR–rated products that reduce drafts and improve comfort.

items.q: How long does window replacement take?
items.a: Many projects are completed in 1–2 days; timelines vary by quantity and custom sizing.

items.q: Will you dispose of my old windows and doors?
items.a: Yes. We remove and haul away existing units and clean the work area.

items.q: Can you match existing trim and style?
items.a: Yes. We offer interior/exterior trim options and finishes to blend with your home.

items.q: What siding options do you offer?
items.a: Vinyl, insulated vinyl, and fiber cement—each with style, durability, and maintenance benefits.

items.q: Does new siding improve energy efficiency?
items.a: Insulated siding can help reduce thermal bridging and improve comfort.

items.q: Do you install house wrap and flashing?
items.a: Yes. We follow best practices for moisture management, flashing, and trim details.

items.q: How long does a siding project take?
items.a: Most homes are completed in about a week, depending on size and details.

items.q: How do you prepare surfaces before painting?
items.a: We wash, scrape, sand, repair, and prime as needed to ensure adhesion and longevity.

items.q: What paints do you use?
items.a: We use premium exterior coatings appropriate for local weather and substrate type.

items.q: How do you protect landscaping and fixtures?
items.a: We cover landscaping, windows, and fixtures; and we clean up thoroughly each day.

items.q: When is the best season to paint exteriors?
items.a: We plan around temperature and humidity to hit manufacturer-recommended application conditions.

items.q: What does your process look like?
items.a: Consultation → design & estimate → build & install → final walkthrough. You’ll get regular updates and a clear timeline.

items.q: How do you handle unexpected issues found during work?
items.a: We document findings (e.g., hidden damage), explain options, and proceed only with your approval.

items.q: How do you keep the job site clean and safe?
items.a: Daily cleanup, protective coverings, and safe material staging. We respect your home and schedule.

items.q: What kind of warranty do you provide?
items.a: Manufacturer warranties on products plus our workmanship warranty on labor. Details vary by scope and materials.
